story.text1: Founded in 1999, Elite Investigations was born from a simple mission: to provide individuals and businesses with the truth they need to make informed decisions. What started as a one-person operation has grown into a full-service investigative agency trusted by attorneys, corporations, and families across the region.
story.text2: Our founder, a former law enforcement officer with over 15 years of experience, recognized the need for professional, ethical, and discreet investigative services in the private sector. Today, we continue to uphold those same values while leveraging cutting-edge technology and proven methodologies.
story.text3: We believe that everyone deserves access to the truth, and we're committed to uncovering it with the highest standards of professionalism and confidentiality.

intro.title: How Can I <1>Help</1> You?
intro.text: I understand that hiring a private investigator can raise many questions. Below are answers to the most common inquiries we receive from our clients.
intro.note: Don't see your question answered below? Contact me for a free consultation where we can discuss your specific needs and concerns.

questions.question: What is a private investigator?
questions.answer: A private investigator is a licensed professional who conducts investigations for individuals, attorneys, businesses, and organizations. We gather facts, collect evidence, and provide detailed reports to help clients make informed decisions about legal, personal, or business matters.

questions.question: Is hiring a private investigator legal?
questions.answer: Yes, hiring a licensed private investigator is legal. Investigators operate within the boundaries of the law and adhere to strict ethical guidelines to protect clients' confidentiality and privacy.

questions.question: What kind of cases do private investigators handle?
questions.answer: Private investigators work on a wide range of cases, including infidelity investigations, background checks, fraud detection, missing persons, surveillance, insurance claims, and more.

questions.question: How much does a private investigation cost?
questions.answer: Costs vary depending on the complexity of the case, the time required, and the type of services needed. We provide a clear estimate after an initial consultation.

questions.question: Is the information collected by a PI admissible in court?
questions.answer: Yes, evidence collected legally by a licensed private investigator can often be used in court. We ensure all information is obtained lawfully and documented thoroughly.

questions.question: How do you ensure confidentiality during an investigation?
questions.answer: Confidentiality is a top priority. All investigations are conducted discreetly, and client information is never shared without consent.

questions.question: How does the investigation process begin?
questions.answer: The process starts with an initial consultation where we discuss your situation, goals, and available information. Based on this, we develop a tailored plan of action and provide a clear overview of the next steps and associated costs.

questions.question: Do I need to provide any documents or information?
questions.answer: Yes, any relevant details or documents you can provide — such as names, addresses, photos, or past incidents — will help us conduct a more efficient and focused investigation.

questions.question: How often will I receive updates during the investigation?
questions.answer: We maintain regular communication and provide updates at key points during the investigation. You're also welcome to contact us at any time with questions or concerns.

questions.question: Will my identity remain confidential?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Client confidentiality is a top priority. We never disclose your identity or involvement in the investigation without your explicit consent.

questions.question: Is the subject of the investigation notified or contacted?
questions.answer: No. Our investigations are conducted discreetly and without the knowledge of the subject, unless required or authorized by law.

questions.question: How is the information I share with you protected?
questions.answer: All information you provide is securely stored and only accessible by authorized personnel. We follow strict data protection and privacy protocols.
